There was one other sighting in Chicago on or around May 4th 2012
Summary: Witnessed a glowing orange sphere-like craft above lightening/thunderstorm.
divs: sighting detailsit was may 4th and i was on a commercial airline heading to o'hare to make a connecting flight to kentucky. for reference, i was sitting at the window on the left side (facing the cockpit) of the plane. while in flight, i was admiring the storm off in the distance when i noticed a peculiar orange light\object moving slowly over the storm. i would estimate that it was at 10:00 and down from where i was at about a 30-35 degree angle. at first i just wrote it off as a plane, even though i could not see the form of it. i reasoned that the distance must have made it look more like a sphere. however, as i observed the object more i became aware that there were no blinking lights. i was further intrigued when the glowing orange object\sphere was at about 7:00-8:00 as it was still bright orange; if what i was seeing were the front lights of an aircraft, then they would be pointed away from the plane i was on and therefore should have changed in luminosity. i also found it strange that this object was very close, almost tracking the lightening\thunderstorm as opposed to avoiding it. it seemed to move at times while at others it seemed to hover. i thought that these movements may just be a matter of misinterpretation of moving around in the plane, but the plane was flying a relatively steady course to o'hare. there may have been other witnesses, but i didn't really care to discuss it with anyone on the plane since i was tired and the object could have been anything. i want to put a disclaimer that i've grown up having an interest in fringe-science and paranormal experiences, so i have a clear bias of wanting to believe. however, because i rely in the scientific method to establish credibility for such findings, i don't jump to conclusions.
